meanings.definition: To be present at an event or place.
meanings.sent1: She attends all the school assemblies.
meanings.sent2: He attends his friend's birthday party.
meanings.sent3: The cat attends the mouse hole, waiting patiently.
meanings.sent4: The sun attends the horizon, marking the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The student attends the front row, eager to learn.

meanings.definition: To take care of or look after someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The nurse attends to the patient's needs.
meanings.sent2: She attends to her garden every morning.
meanings.sent3: The dog attends to the baby, licking its face.
meanings.sent4: The moon attends to the tides, guiding their flow.
meanings.sent5: The farmer attends to the crops, ensuring they thrive.

meanings.definition: To pay attention to or listen to something.
meanings.sent1: The students attend carefully to the teacher's instructions.
meanings.sent2: He attends to the details of the contract.
meanings.sent3: The cat attends to the bird chirping outside.
meanings.sent4: The wind attends to the leaves, rustling them softly.
meanings.sent5: The child attends to the story, captivated by the plot.
